title: Relates to the establishment of a pilot program for courts for the treatment of veterans
summary: Relates to the establishment of a pilot program for courts for the treatment of veterans in the city of Utica and New York city; expires after two years.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1202

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  GRIFFO -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Judiciary

       AN ACT to amend the judiciary law, in relation to the establishment of a
         pilot program for courts for the treatment of veterans; and  providing
         for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The judiciary law is amended by adding a new article 5-C to
    2  read as follows:
    3                                 ARTICLE 5-C
    4                        VETERANS COURTS PILOT PROGRAM
    5  SECTION 178-A. ESTABLISHMENT OF COURTS FOR VETERANS; PILOT PROGRAM.
    6          178-B. TRANSFER OF CASES TO COURTS FOR  TREATMENT  OF  VETERANS;
    7                   HOW EFFECTUATED.
    8          178-C. PROCEDURE  IN  A COURT FOR VETERANS UPON TRANSFER OF CASE
    9                   THERETO.
   10    S 178-A. ESTABLISHMENT OF COURTS  FOR  VETERANS;  PILOT  PROGRAM.  THE
   11  CHIEF  ADMINISTRATOR  OF THE COURTS, BY ADMINISTRATIVE ORDER, IS AUTHOR-
   12  IZED AND DIRECTED TO ESTABLISH A COURT FOR VETERANS IN THE CITY COURT OF
   13  THE CITY OF UTICA, AND IN THE SUPREME COURTS OF THE CITY  OF  NEW  YORK,
   14  AND ASSIGN ONE OR MORE JUSTICES OR JUDGES TO PRESIDE THEREIN. SUCH COURT
   15  FOR VETERANS SHALL HAVE AS ITS PURPOSE THE HEARING AND DETERMINATION OF:
   16    (A)  CRIMINAL  CASES  THAT  ARE  COMMENCED IN THE CITY COURT AGAINST A
   17  DEFENDANT IDENTIFIED AS A VETERAN; AND
   18    (B) CRIMINAL CASES THAT ARE COMMENCED IN OTHER COURTS OF  THE  COUNTY,
   19  AND  THAT  ARE IDENTIFIED AS APPROPRIATE FOR DISPOSITION BY THE VETERANS
   20  COURT AND TRANSFERRED TO THE COURT AS PROVIDED IN  SECTION  ONE  HUNDRED
   21  SEVENTY-EIGHT-B OF THIS ARTICLE.
   22    S  178-B.  TRANSFER  OF CASES TO COURTS FOR TREATMENT OF VETERANS; HOW
   23  EFFECTUATED. (A) TRANSFER OF CASES PENDING IN LOCAL CRIMINAL COURTS.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01805-01-1

       S. 1202                             2

    1    (1) A LOCAL CRIMINAL COURT IN A COUNTY IN WHICH A COURT  FOR  VETERANS
    2  HAS  BEEN ESTABLISHED UNDER THIS ARTICLE MAY, UPON MOTION OF THE DEFEND-
    3  ANT AND WITH THE CONSENT OF  THE  DISTRICT  ATTORNEY,  CAUSE  COPIES  OF
    4  PAPERS  AND  OTHER  DOCUMENTS  FILED  IN  SUCH  LOCAL  CRIMINAL COURT IN
    5  CONNECTION  WITH  A  CRIMINAL ACTION OR PROCEEDING PENDING THEREIN TO BE
    6  SENT TO THE COURT FOR VETERANS:
    7    (I) UPON OR AFTER ARRAIGNMENT OF THE DEFENDANT  ON  A  LOCAL  CRIMINAL
    8  COURT  ACCUSATORY  INSTRUMENT  BY  WHICH  SUCH  ACTION OR PROCEEDING WAS
    9  COMMENCED; OR
   10    (II) UPON OR AFTER COMMENCEMENT OF  A  PROCEEDING  BROUGHT  AGAINST  A
   11  DEFENDANT FOR THE VIOLATION OF A CONDITION OF A SENTENCE OF PROBATION OR
   12  A SENTENCE OF CONDITIONAL DISCHARGE.
   13    (2) NOT LATER THAN FIVE DAYS FOLLOWING RECEIPT OF THE PAPERS AND OTHER
   14  DOCUMENTS,  THE  JUSTICE  OR  JUDGE  PRESIDING IN THE COURT FOR VETERANS
   15  SHALL DETERMINE WHETHER OR NOT A TRANSFER OF THE ACTION OR PROCEEDING TO
   16  THE COURT WOULD PROMOTE THE ADMINISTRATION OF JUSTICE. IF THE JUSTICE OR
   17  JUDGE PRESIDING IN THE COURT DETERMINES THAT IT WOULD,  HE  OR  SHE  MAY
   18  ORDER  SUCH  TRANSFER,  IN WHICH EVENT THE ACTION OR PROCEEDING SHALL BE
   19  TRANSFERRED TO THE COURT FOR VETERANS, ALL ORIGINATING PAPERS SHALL THEN
   20  BE SENT FROM THE ORIGINATING COURT TO THE COURT FOR  VETERANS,  AND  ALL
   21  FURTHER  PROCEEDINGS SHALL BE CONDUCTED THEREIN. IF THE JUSTICE OR JUDGE
   22  DETERMINES THAT A TRANSFER OF THE ACTION OR PROCEEDING WOULD NOT PROMOTE
   23  THE ADMINISTRATION OF JUSTICE, HE OR SHE SHALL NOTIFY THE LOCAL CRIMINAL
   24  COURT OR OTHER COURT FROM WHICH  THE  REFERENCE  WAS  RECEIVED  OF  SUCH
   25  DETERMINATION,  WHEREUPON  ALL  FURTHER  PROCEEDINGS  IN  SUCH ACTION OR
   26  PROCEEDING SHALL BE CONDUCTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH LAW.
   27    (B) TRANSFER OF CASES PENDING IN SUPERIOR COURTS.
   28    (1) AT ANY TIME WHILE A CRIMINAL ACTION OR PROCEEDING IS PENDING IN  A
   29  SUPERIOR COURT IN A COUNTY IN WHICH A COURT FOR VETERANS HAS BEEN ESTAB-
   30  LISHED,  INCLUDING  A  PROCEEDING  BROUGHT  AGAINST  A DEFENDANT FOR THE
   31  VIOLATION OF A CONDITION OF A SENTENCE OF PROBATION  OR  A  SENTENCE  OF
   32  CONDITIONAL  DISCHARGE,  A  JUDGE  OR  JUSTICE OF THE COURT IN WHICH THE
   33  ACTION OR PROCEEDING IS PENDING MAY, UPON MOTION OF  THE  DEFENDANT  AND
   34  WITH  THE  CONSENT  OF THE DISTRICT ATTORNEY, CAUSE COPIES OF PAPERS AND
   35  OTHER DOCUMENTS FILED IN SUCH COURT IN CONNECTION  WITH  THE  ACTION  OR
   36  PROCEEDING TO BE SENT TO THE JUDGE OR JUSTICE PRESIDING IN THE COURT FOR
   37  VETERANS FOR REVIEW OF THE APPROPRIATENESS OF THE TRANSFER.
   38    (2)  NOT LATER THAN FIVE BUSINESS DAYS FOLLOWING RECEIPT OF THE PAPERS
   39  AND OTHER DOCUMENTS, THE JUDGE OR JUSTICE PRESIDING  IN  THE  COURT  FOR
   40  VETERANS  SHALL  DETERMINE  WHETHER  OR  NOT A TRANSFER OF THE ACTION OR
   41  PROCEEDING TO THE COURT WOULD PROMOTE THE ADMINISTRATION OF JUSTICE.  IF
   42  SUCH JUDGE OR JUSTICE DETERMINES THAT IT WOULD:
   43    (I)  HE  OR SHE, IF SITTING IN SUPREME COURT, MAY ORDER SUCH TRANSFER,
   44  IN WHICH EVENT THE ACTION OR PROCEEDING SHALL BE REFERRED  FOR  DISPOSI-
   45  TION TO THE COURT FOR VETERANS, ALL ORIGINAL PAPERS SHALL BE SENT TO THE
   46  COURT  FOR  VETERANS,  AND  ALL  FURTHER  PROCEEDINGS  IN SUCH ACTION OR
   47  PROCEEDING SHALL BE CONDUCTED THEREIN; OR
   48    (II) HE OR SHE, IF SITTING  IN  COUNTY  COURT,  SHALL  SO  NOTIFY  THE
   49  JUSTICE  OF  THE  COURT  WHO CAUSED THE PAPERS AND OTHER DOCUMENTS TO BE
   50  SENT TO HIM OR HER, AND SUCH JUSTICE MAY THEREUPON ORDER SUCH  TRANSFER,
   51  IN  WHICH  EVENT THE ACTION OR PROCEEDING SHALL BE REFERRED FOR DISPOSI-
   52  TION TO THE COURT FOR VETERANS, ALL ORIGINAL PAPERS SHALL BE  SENT  FROM
   53  THE  ORIGINATING  COURT  TO  THE  COURT  FOR  VETERANS,  AND ALL FURTHER
   54  PROCEEDINGS IN SUCH ACTION OR PROCEEDING SHALL BE CONDUCTED THEREIN.  IF
   55  THE JUDGE OR JUSTICE PRESIDING IN THE COURT FOR VETERANS DETERMINES THAT
   56  A  TRANSFER  OF  THE ACTION OR PROCEEDING WOULD NOT PROMOTE THE ADMINIS-

       S. 1202                             3

    1  TRATION OF JUSTICE, HE OR SHE SHALL NOTIFY THE ORIGINATING COURT OF SUCH
    2  DETERMINATION, WHEREUPON ALL  FURTHER  PROCEEDINGS  IN  SUCH  ACTION  OR
    3  PROCEEDING SHALL BE CONDUCTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH LAW.
    4    S 178-C. PROCEDURE IN A COURT FOR VETERANS UPON TRANSFER OF CASE THER-
    5  ETO.   EACH ACTION OR PROCEEDING TRANSFERRED FROM A LOCAL CRIMINAL COURT
    6  TO A SUPERIOR COURT AND REFERRED FOR DISPOSITION TO A COURT FOR VETERANS
    7  THEREOF SHALL BE SUBJECT TO THE SAME SUBSTANTIVE AND PROCEDURAL  LAW  AS
    8  WOULD HAVE APPLIED TO IT HAD IT NOT BEEN TRANSFERRED.
    9    S  2. This act shall take effect on the first of January next succeed-
   10  ing the date on which it shall have become a law and shall expire and be
   11  deemed repealed 2 years after such effective date.
